thread.title: Cleveland Cavaliers tickets go on sale, prices go up
thread.title_full: Cleveland Cavaliers tickets go on sale, prices go up

title: Cleveland Cavaliers tickets go on sale, prices go up
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Cleveland Cavaliers tickets go on sale, prices go up This year, fans will have the opportunity to purchase tickets for any game of the entire regular season home schedule Post to Facebook Cleveland Cavaliers tickets go on sale, prices go up This year, fans will have the opportunity to purchase tickets for any game of the entire regular season home schedule  //on.wkyc.com/1FGBg86   Join the Conversation To   Cleveland Cavaliers tickets go on sale, prices go up September 30, 2015: This year, fans will have the opportunity to purchase tickets for any game of the entire regular season home schedule Wale Aliyu, WKYC 12:13 a.m. EDT October 1, 2015 Cleveland Cavaliers . (AP Photo/Mark Duncan) (Photo: Mark Duncan, ASSOCIATED PRESS) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CLEVELAND -- Tickets for all 41 regular-season Cleveland Cavaliers home games for the 2015-2016 season went on sale Wednesday. 
There are signs outside of Quicken Loans Arena advertising for you to purchase tickets on Cavs.com . 
The team doesn't have the excitement from last year, when LeBron James came back, but the team is coming off a finals run. 
As tickets went on sale, we noticed a few changes. 
READ MORE | Kevin Love returned to Cavaliers for title chase 
First off, the single-game ticket purchase procedure is different from last season. 
Last year, the team used a monthly lottery to manage the initial surge and unprecedented demand for tickets. Under the lottery format, registered fans were randomly selected for the chance to purchase tickets that were released each month for future games. 
"I don't like the fact that you have to be in the lottery to see if you get a ticket," said Cavs fan Daniel Aponte. "I would rather be able to walk up and see if I want some tickets and buy them." 
This year, fans will have the opportunity to purchase tickets for any regular-season game. 
Similar to last season, there will be more than 50,000 individual tickets available for purchase throughout the season. 
This process adjustment was determined based on fan feedback, monitoring of game-by-game demand for ticket inventory and purchasing data last season. 
RELATED | Cavaliers hit ground running on first day of camp 
"I heard they are doing dynamic pricing so there will be different prices for different games," said fan Erica Aber. "It makes sense because a lot of teams across the league are doing that, so I know people fill the seats." 
Demand on a game-by-game basis determines prices. And the price for the first regular-season home game, the night before Halloween, may be a little scary. 
The cheapest ticket we found Wednesday night was selling for $99 in the farthest section from the court. If you want something up close, prices reach as high as $8,025. 
"That's not surprising," said Aber. 
But tickets do get much cheaper when we're not talking about the home opener against the Miami Heat. 
Still, ticket pricing increased 15 percent from last season to this season. This is the first time the ticket prices have increased in the last five seasons. 
"I will still go, it don't matter," said Aponte. 
READ MORE | Cavs optimistic Tristan Thompson deal will get done 
"It makes sense after we reached the finals," said Aber. "They had to ease into it because we had a few years of bad seasons. And finally we got some wins under our belt." 
Another difference comes with the demand for season tickets. Last year, season tickets sold out in 24 hours. This year, there are still some available. 
Follow WKYC's Wale Aliyu on Twitter @WaleAliyu and on Facebook at facebook.com/WaleAliyuTV <!--iframe--> Read or Share this story: http://on.wkyc.com/1FGBg86 TOP VIDEOS
